oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 05 k. Newspaper clipping: 'Mrs. l. Crozier French Stands For Protection Of City's Weak.' [1923]
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women;

oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mrs. L Crozier French Stands For Protection Of City's Weak Mrs. L. Crozier French, woman's candidate for council at large, is in for every progressive movement that will tend to make Knoxville a desirable place to live and a greater business center, she declared yesterday in announcing her platform. She also declared that she is for adequate protection for women and children, support for the weak and unfortunate and a city government that achieves its purpose without waste or extravagance. Another plea Mrs. French makes for support is that she has no other thing to occupy her and can devote full time to the city's service. Mrs. French has been active in public life of Knoxville for many years, having been the founder of Ossoli Circle and other civic clubs designed for the city's betterment. Her experience also extends into educational and uplift fields, where she has worked untiringly. Mrs. French says she is in the race in response to urgent requests from her friends that she is to take up the women's cause in the election and carry it through.
